alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Washington (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 26 at 6:12PM MDT until May 26 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MORGAN AND NORTH CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 611 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Sterling to 7 miles northeast of Woodlin School, or along a line extending from 35 miles northwest of Yuma to 23 miles southwest of Akron, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Morgan and north central Washington Counties, including the following locations... Fremont Butte. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
